reviews.review: 재미씀
Yes
Мне очень нравиться

Este é um bom jogo que revolucionou o seu gênero , entretanto há falhas que a empresa insiste em cometer , muitos bugs que penam para ser corrigidos , nos últimos tempos a empresa tem melhorado nessa questão , porém o problemas dos bugs era algo para ser notado a muito tempo , mas vamos esquecer isto , o que dizer dos novos eventos ? PATÉTICOS , totalmente reciclados e sem criatividade , a empresa sabe que você quer moedinhas no jogo , então os eventos são para te dar isto , porém porque não criar algo divertido do que simplesmente colocar um evento super genérico no jogo que vem sendo repitidos a anos ..outra coisa é o balanciamento , eu diria que é um jogo meio termo, dá pra se divertir sim tanto de killer tanto de survivor
Porém vamos a um exemplo :  se você está de killer e você é um cara bom e  cai com um grupo ruim ,você vencerá ,
se você cai com um grupo mediano você vencerá ,
se você cai com um grupo de cara bom , você será totalmente massacrado , não generalizando mas é o que normalmente se ver por aí... pois o jogo é mais roubado para os sobreviventes .

Agora eu gostaria de deixar claro que sim O JOGO É BOM e você vai se divertir bastante , se você tem amigos , legal , irá se divertir com survivos , se você é um cara solitário , legal (ou não) , irá se divertir como killer , então no fim de tudo acabo recomendando o jogo , há coisas ruins assim como boas , haverá momentos divertidos assim como tiltantes ... deixo a seu critério mas eu avalio positivamente.

In light of the #deadbyboycott cringe, I have decided that I will make a proper stand. Instead of the soyboy #deadbyboycott, I present #immortalbymymoney. I have played this game for over 1k hours and I can say that I have loved this game for most the hours. So much of my time and mental energy has gone into dbd and I would hate to not support dbd. Not because I don't think that the game has issues. I know the game has so many bugs that lurk in the chaotic and hectic code. I have had games be thrown away by game breaking bugs. However they are simply the trials and tribulations of a game that is getting too big for its own good. 

TLDR, don't support the cringe. #immortalbymymoney.

DbDをプレイしたせいで不幸になったので二度とやりたくない。
今後マッチング調整や初心者救済のBP配布がない限り今からソロで始める人は絶対やらないほうがいい。
最初からパーティ組める人か100時間虚無に耐えられるドMの人ならDbDはやってもいいと思います。
サバイバーは必要なパーク揃えるまでに何回もパークが揃ったキラーに初心者サバイバー全員ボコボコにされて絶望。
キラーは必要なパーク揃えるまでに何回もパークが揃ったサバイバーや連携出来すぎてるパーティに虐められて絶望。
パーク揃えたうえで立ち回りやパーク構成とか覚えたいのにBP無さすぎてパーク揃えるまでの虚無の時間が多すぎる。

TL;DR -This game hella toxic, very unbalanced and the studio needs a wake up call

I have played a ridiculous amount of this game. I got it for free Halloween 2018 because some people wanted to play it with me and I quickly sunk a lot of hours into it. None of those people still play this game because they are so fed up with the toxicity the community engages in and how the developers ignore and encourage this toxicity. I played this game, and brought a lot of DLC, because of how fun it is to play with friends, but what's the point in playing a game where you get frustrated with underhanded players when we could just play a coop game against AI where the chance of being tea bagged (or hit on hook) doesn't exist)
Killer play styles that are considered underhanded and frankly strip the fun out of the game: camping a hooked survivor, downing several survivors and not hooking them in the hopes you can cripple all the survivors (or slugging), abuse of game mechanics, tunnelling (targeting one survivor, especially those just unhooked) all run rampant and the problem gets worse by the day. The only survivor perks that are able to counter these behaviours are nerfed (because the developers consider the way a minority of players to be using them to be detrimental to the game and so deciding to punish the rest of the players too). On the flip side toxic survivors, who abuse various mechanics meant for self preservation to bully less experienced killers, use of flashlight spam or even sabotaging other survivors has no repercussions if a killer isn't as skilled or better (which we'll come back to later) and trying to report players for such behaviour falls on deaf ears with the devs outright saying "we won't punish players for this action" despite it ruining all the fun of the game for everyone and driving players away in droves
The matchmaking system is frequently subject to changes (due to it desperately needing an overhaul of some kind) but this invariably results with literal beginners with half an hour's play time facing off against players who have sunk a disturbing amount of time into the game. The fixation on rank also leads to issues with the aforementioned toxicity as players become to focused on improving their rank to consider if they are enjoying the game and if they are making it enjoyable for others.
Certain killers are also frequently overpowered, Spirit and Doctor being the main contenders with whatever the latest release often muscling in on their territory (currently Nemesis who immediately tanks the frame rate) while other killers are often neglected and underpowered. As a result instead of the interest of "what killer will I be against today?" you are left with "which overpowered crap is this toxic ass going to play?" which again saps the fun away. There needs to be a better balancing system in play for killers, with more frequent tweaks being made and a better more focused way to encourage playing a variety of killers
There is also currently a policy on the official forums to remove any post about the current boycott and ban any user who posts about it, which reeks of higher corporate censorship- this I absolutely do not blame the devs for, but I also cannot recommend a game where such actions happen behind the scenes. The boycott itself was over how there has been a serious push to tart up the game and push for transactions over fixing any real issues (the Binding of Kin chapter was notorious for this issue) and horrific amounts of instability (the Resident Evil map is still under observation more than a month after release due to it literally crashing everyone's game when it was first released and being "locked" for 2 weeks after that) and general grindiness of the game. BHVR has done very little to address these concerns, if anything. This game has a stranglehold on the asymmetric PVP horror genre, and is the only real title BHVR has and as such the suits are clearly milking this game for all it is worth.

I really want to enjoy this game. The fact that I have spent over 200 hours playing this mess and then a further 30 writing this review shows that I care about this. I want to be able to sit back with some friends and play a handful of games against players who aren't going to be total ♥♥♥♥♥. I want to know that there is some real serious effort going into making this game as good as it can be and not getting as much money from it as possible. I would like it to be actually balanced (or as balanced as a game built around unbalance can be) but right now that just doesn't seem like it's going to happen
